author: Staff Reporter
text:
A day after the District Election Officer and Collector V. Sampath asked officials to strictly follow the model code of conduct without any delay, vehicle checks have been intensified across the district on Sunday.

For each of the 11 Assembly constituencies in the district, a flying squad, a static surveillance committee, a video viewing committee and an accounts committee have been deployed for round-the-clock monitoring of vehicles and election expenditure.

embers of the flying squad checked the vehicles in the city and across the district. Also, vehicles entering from Karnataka through Palar in Kolathur were also subjected to checks. Meanwhile, the weekly grievances redressal day meetings being conducted on every Monday stands cancelled until the election process is completed. But the public can drop their grievance petitions in the box kept at the ground floor of the Collectorate.

Workers have been engaged to remove hoardings, posters, banners, cut-outs and political graffiti across the district.
title: Vehicle checks intensified
